properties.name: Falcon Ridge Folk Festival, Hillsdale, NY, USA
properties.description: Posted by Barabas7Hillsdale NYA four-day community of folk music and dance at the foot of the Berkshires in east-central New York State. This will be our eighteenth year of music, dance, and fun.

properties.name: Field, BC, Canada
properties.description: Posted by Barabas7 Field, BCDid you ever watch Northern Exposure? Field, BC is just like Cicely, AK. I spent a week one August in Field, while hiking in the Canadian Rockies. The headquarters for Yoho National Park. Canoeing on Emerald Lake. Visits to Banff and Jasper National Parks.

properties.name: First Out Cafe-Bar
properties.description: Posted by Barabas7  St GilesEstablished in 1986, First Out is London\'s first lesbian & gay cafe-bar. Everyone loves First Out for its blend of friendly cafe\' life and relaxed bar.

properties.name: Fort William, Scotland, UK
properties.description: Posted by Barabas7 The end of the West Highland Way, which I hiked (from Glasgow) with my good friend Jon over eight days in 1995, and the beginning of the Great Glen Way (to Inverness) which I hiked with Jon, George, and Kirk over six days in 2005. The West Highland Way, my first long-distance hike with Jon, was the best hike we have had!

properties.name: Gay City State Park, Connecticut, USA
properties.description: Posted by Barabas7  Miles of hiking/cross-country skiing trails. House foundations and a chimney, the site of an old mill dating from the 1700s. Gay City was first settled in 1796, a now-extinct mill town that once occupied the site.

properties.name: ManyGlacier/Swiftcurrent, Monana, USA
properties.description: Posted by Barabas7 First night in Glacier National Park. Hiked the next day to Grinnell Glacier and back, could hardly walk for a day after that. Drove the Going to the Sun Road... just when you thought you had seen the most beautiful panorama possible, you\'d round a curve to see something even more spectacular! This happened over and over...

properties.name: Monhegan Island, Maine, USA
properties.description: Posted by Barabas7 Monhegan is a small, rocky island ten miles from the nearest mainland and scarcely a square mile in area. It is accessible only by boat and there are no cars or paved roads on the Island. About 17 miles of trails, often steep and strenuous, lead through wooded areas and over rocky ledges up to the highest ocean cliffs on the Maine coastline.

properties.name: Sally Gap, Wicklow Mountains, Ireland
properties.description: Posted by Barabas7The Sally Gap is the highest crossroads in Ireland. My friend Jon and I took our rented bicycles on the train south from Dublin and cycled up-hill in the rain till we reached the top of a waterfall. Silly me, I thought the road would flatten out after that. Well, where did I think the water was coming from? Once past the waterfall, there was an endless climb with switchbacks galore! I was hypoglycemic and hypothermic! Pelting cold rain! Once through the crossroads, we soon came upon a small tea-shop in the middle of no-where. When we told the hostess what we had been doing, she asked "Are you mad?!?!" I replied, pointing at Jon, "He\'s mad; I\'m a fool!"

properties.name: Seven Dials
properties.description: Posted by Barabas7The Seven Dials can be found to the north west of Covent Garden market, and just to the south of Shaftesbury Avenue. They radiate from a roundabout, and comprise Earlham Street, Monmouth Street, Mercer Street and Shorts Gardens. The district now known as the Seven Dials also includes Neal Street and Neals Yard....an oasis in the centre of London - packed with small, independent shops and leasing floor space to many small businesses.
